reviews.review_msg: This was a TERRIBLE class. You dont even need to go to class, all her notes are online and they are direct summaries from the textbook!  No tutorials suked, and the TA's were useless.  Her exams were super unfair, and her ability to instruct the material was the worst I have ever seen.  RUN AWAY from this teacher, she is AWFUL!!!
ahhh! helP!. am i in hell?

Hard class but very interesting. It was exciting to learn more about the different philosophies of psychologists. Great that he pretty much gives you the answers to exams but some off the stuff you won't get until months later and you cover a simplified version elsewhere. Best advice is listen to the lecture AND attend the class.
Tim is a great Proff! Just do the readings & read his lecture notes and you will be fine...he does a great job explaining!

The classes aren't mandatory (lectures were recorded) and as long as you study the lecture notes/textbook you'll get a good grade. I liked the videos in class and Tim pushes you to material in different ways than the text portrays.

Tim is a great prof and I loved his teaching style! He tells you things not in the book to make you critically think! Midterm was ok the final was harder and for the paper consult your TMs when unclear. He gives the essays for exams in advance so check with the TMs to make sure you do not miss anything and you will do well!

Racine is a funny guy. When you talk to him in person he is a little intimidating. I loved his example videos in class they were entertaining. His tests are pretty fair, a little on a tough side. everything is scaled so it depends on the class. The paper will bump ur mark up, however midterms and finals you really need to study for. USE THE TEXT!:)

He's a very funny professor, but it drove me insane how he always went off on a tangent about somthing random. Another complaint I have is his allowance for absolutely stupid questions from students in the class, which always came from the same few students. As long as you attend every lecture and do the readings, you'll do well in this class.
Great Prof. Structured the course really well- no tutorials for first 2 weeks, midterm on two separate days (multiple choice one day, written another day), non-cumulative exams. Fair marking.

Easy class if you complete in class assignments and group project. She does test on things that aren't in textbook attendance is important. There are participation weekly in class assignment worth an easy 15%. Very high grading scale due to this. Group Project is a lot of work - 30%. Makes study guides exams - lowest mark of 3 is dropped

Dr. Borsch is by far one of my favourite profs I've encountered thus far at SFU. She is very passionate about the material, and tries her best to convey the material that is appealing to her students. She is such a friendly woman, and she also uses videos in her lectures to make them more interesting. I highly recommend taking her class.

She's not prepared for lectures, often unsure of info that is CLEARLY marked on slide and tries 'demos' with imaginary props. Her train of thought is all over and often mis-speaks or gets confused. Going to lectures are waste of time (except for quizes), it's better to listen to audio and follow slides. Content is easy so you can teach yourself!

I've had Sherri for 2 classes. She underplays the importance of many topics to her exams. Her marking is absurd. I get stellar marks in the rest of my courses, but somehow w/ her it's a struggle. EVERY slide is essential and EVERY slide is PACKED with minutia. She tests finicky details, and doesn't appear to look for understanding of concepts.

Really great prof! Midterm had a lot of short answer pulled from lecture discussions & videos, but still had a lot of content from the textook. 2 in-class essays: 1 individual & 1 with 2 people, really easy! Prepare for them both in class the week beforehand.
She's very laid back and has a great sense of humour. Attending classes is a MUST because she doesn't use the textbook. Overall, straightforward class.
